Below is where saved configurations appear when you choose to save a vehicle. Click Save to save the current configuration to your garage.
1. Manufacturer's Suggested Retail Price, excludes the Delivery, Processing and Handling Fee of $810 for Cars, $860 for Small/Medium Trucks (Sienna, RAV4, Highlander Gas, Highlander HV, FJ Cruiser, 4Runner, Tacoma and Venza), and $995 for Large Trucks (Land Cruiser, Tundra and Sequoia). (Historically, vehicle manufacturers and distributors have charged a separate fee for processing, handling and delivering vehicles to dealerships. Toyota's charge for these services is called the "Delivery, Processing and Handling Fee" and is based on the value of the processing, handling and delivery services Toyota provides as well as Toyota's overall pricing structure. Toyota may make a profit on the Delivery, Processing and Handling Fee.) Excludes taxes, license, title and available or regionally required equipment. The Delivery, Processing and Handling Fee in AL, AR, FL, GA, LA, MS, NC, OK, SC and TX will be higher. Actual dealer price will vary.
2. 2014 EPA-estimated mileage. Actual mileage will vary.
3. Always drive safely, obey traffic laws and focus on the road and traffic conditions while driving. Availability and accuracy of the information provided by the Navigation system or any HD services are dependent upon many factors. Use common sense when relying on information provided. Services and programming subject to change. Services not available in every city or roadway. Navigation updates are available at an additional cost from your Toyota dealer. See your Navigation System Owner's Manual or Toyota dealer for details. HD RadioTM Technology manufactured under license from iBiquity Digital Corporation U.S. and Foreign Patents. HD RadioTM and the HD, HD Radio, and "Arc" logos are proprietary trademarks of iBiquity Digital Corp.
4. Always drive safely, obey traffic laws and focus on the road and traffic conditions while driving. Select Entune® App Suite apps use a large amount of data and you are responsible for all data charges. Apps and services vary by phone and carrier; not all services available all the time and in all locations, and are subject to change. Apps identified by "TM" or "®" are trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective companies and cannot be used without permission. See toyota.com/entune for the latest information regarding registration, apps and services, and other details.
Schedule Hangout

Confirm Hangout
▼Who can I invite to “Collaborate” with me?
As long as you have a Gmail/G+ account, anyone you like. You can bring in friends, fellow car enthusiasts or coworkers. Anyone you think might be helpful in building your next car. We suggest keeping the group small: No one wants a car designed by committee.
▼Do my friends and family need Google+ accounts to join me in a Hangout?
Yes. At this time, only people with a Google+ account can use the Collaborator.
▼Do my friends and family have to be online to join a Hangout?
Yes, they do. A fast internet connection is recommended.
▼What’s the difference between the 2-D and 3-D view options?
The Collaborator launches in 2-D mode, which lets you toggle between four different views of your custom car. If you’re on a faster computer, try the 3-D mode – you’ll be able to rotate your Corolla for a 360° view, plus overhead views. If 3-D mode is running slowly, switching back to the 2-D option should speed things up.
▼Can I customize other Toyota vehicles?
No, at this time only Corolla can be customized.
▼Can I save my Corolla once I build it? And where is it stored?
Once you have built your vehicle, you can save up to three different versions of it. You will want to choose a custom name for each one so you don’t get them confused. Now you can see the difference between building a car on your own, and letting your friends help.
▼How do I talk to, or find, a dealer?
One way is to invite them to your Google Hangout by selecting the Talk to an Expert function. This will allow you to invite a local dealer to your Hangout. They are happy to answer questions, give advice or just talk about all things Toyota. Please note that this feature may not be available in your area. If that’s the case, go here to talk to a dealer in your area.
▼What are the system requirements for Collaborator?
Collaborator works best with the Chrome browser. We want your Toyota shopping experience to be as easy as possible. You can download it here if you don’t have it already: https://www.google.com/intl/en/chrome/browser/
▼Can I take my Collaboration to the dealer?
Of course you can. Just save your build in PDF format, and you can take that to the dealership.
▼Who sees my Collaboration? Can I change it?
You can share your build with as many, or few, people as you like. Just adjust your settings in Google Hangout to adjust how many people can see your latest custom vehicle.
▼Can I use Collaborator on my smartphone?
Toyota Collaborator is designed only to work on your desktop for now. If you don’t have a desktop to view it, ask one of your friends. You can still save your creation and have access to it whenever you like.
▼How do I add people to my Collaborator?
The same way you add friends to any of your Google Hangouts. Simply select them from your list of Google contacts. You can choose up to ten.
▼Can I build more than one car?
You have the option to create and save up to three builds. After that, you will need to delete one before you can save another. Feel free to build as many as you like, though, so you can be sure to create one you love.
▼Why can I not put everything I want on my vehicle?
Not every option and feature is available on every trim. Each model only has a set amount of configurations, but we try to appeal to everyone’s taste and style.
▼What do you mean when you say trim?
This is how we talk about the possible model grades of each vehicle. For Corolla, possible trims are L, LE, LE Eco and S. If you want to know more about trims for Corolla, please visit toyota.com.
▼Why does the color of my car change when I change the wheels or trim?
Some color options aren’t available with certain wheels or trim packages. Try starting with your preferred trim package and building from there.
▼What is a CVT transmission, and why is it a good thing?
CVT stands for Continuously Variable Transmission. Basically this transmission helps maximize fuel efficiency and provides a smoother drive in comparison with a traditional automatic transmission.
▼What is Corolla’s mpg?
MPG varies with Corolla models, and of course, your driving habits, but the LE Eco is EPA-estimated at 42 hwy. mpg.2 The other models also offer equally impressive mpg estimates.
▼How can I get more information on Corolla’s warranty?
Your dealer will be your best resource for any warranty information. Another great place to ask questions is the Ask an Owner page, another great resource for learning about Toyota. You can visit it at http://www.toyota.com/owners/ask-an-owner/
▼What is Entune® App Suite?
This is Toyota's revolutionary in-car technology. Entune® App Suite4 is a collection of popular mobile applications and data services that are now accessible right from inside your Toyota. Now you can stay connected, no matter where you are.
 
Starting msrp shown for all trims. Adding features may increase msrp. Contact your local dealer for actual pricing.
